front.head: The HAPPY HUSBAND, And The OLD BATCHELOR. A Dialogue.

lg.l: Of honest fame and good estate,
Who with a Sober virtuous Wife,
For many Years had led his life;
Walk'd in the Fields to take the Air,
And chanc'd to meet his Neighbour there,
Polite, and gay, of humour free;
Who long had been to love inclin'd,
But ne'er cou'd fix his wav'ring mind,
And being met at his desire,
They to his Neighbouring house retire;
A Rural Seat, which for long Space
Had gone in the Paternal race,
There in the Hall they both regale
With generous Wine and Nappy Ale,
The Guest talk'd of Returning home.
